glsa.title: Blender: User-assisted remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in Blender allowing for user-assisted arbitrary code execution.

background.p: Blender is a 3D creation, animation and publishing program.

description.p: Stefan Cornelius of Secunia Research discovered an insecure use of the "eval()" function in kmz_ImportWithMesh.py.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted Blender file (.kmz or .kml), resulting in the execution of arbitrary Python code with the privileges of the user running Blender.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Blender users should upgrade to the latest version:
